summary.text_en: Darwin proposed theory of evolution! He discovered species not fixed but gradually evolve through natural selection. Individuals adapted to environment more likely survive and reproduce, unadapted eliminated. This theory completely changed human understanding of life's origins, greatest discovery in biology history.

story.text_en: In 1831, 22-year-old Darwin boarded HMS Beagle, beginning 5-year voyage around world. On GalÃ¡pagos Islands, he found finches on each island had different beak shapes: seed-eaters had thick beaks, insect-eaters had thin beaks. He realized: these finches originally same species, evolved different beaks to adapt to different foods! After returning, he spent 20 years organizing evidence, published 'Origin of Species' in 1859, shocking the world.

fun_facts.text_en: GalÃ¡pagos tortoises live 200 years, Darwin rode on tortoise for photo, that tortoise might still be alive!
He delayed 20 years before publishing 'Origin of Species', fearing religious controversy.
As child he loved collecting beetles, once held beetle in mouth while hands held two more!
He married cousin Emma, very loving couple, had 10 children.

experiment.description_en: On GalÃ¡pagos Islands, Darwin found 13 finch species with different beak shapes. Ground finches eating large seeds had thick beaks crushing hard seeds; tree finches eating insects had thin beaks catching bugs from bark crevices; cactus finches had sharp beaks piercing cacti. Darwin deduced: these finches share common ancestor, after reaching different islands, evolved different beaks adapting to different food sources. This is most classic evidence of natural selection.
experiment.why_en: Different food sources create different selection pressures, individuals with beak shapes suited to food more likely survive, passing genes to offspring.

simple_explanation.text_en: Imagine group of giraffes. Some have long necks, some short. Leaves all high up, short-necked can't reach, starve; long-necked eat well, survive and have many baby giraffes. After thousands of generations, all giraffes have long necks! This is natural selection: environment like sieve, filtering out unadapted, keeping adapted. Not that giraffes wanted long necks, but short-necked ones eliminated.

impact.text_en: Darwin's evolution theory is greatest theory in biology history! It explained life's diversity and complexity, unifying entire biology. Evolution not only changed science, but profoundly influenced philosophy, sociology, psychology fields. It challenged 'creationism', sparking great science-religion debate. Today, evolution is cornerstone of modern biology, from molecular biology to ecology, all fields built on evolutionary foundation.

influenced_by.contribution_en: Population theory inspired struggle for existence concept

influenced.contribution_en: DNA structure revealed genetic material basis
Modern synthesis combined genetics and evolution

influence_chain.legacy_text_en: Darwin inspired by Lamarck's organism change idea, Lyell's geological gradualism, and Malthus's population theory, proposed natural selection. Mendel's genetics explained how variations inherited. Watson and Crick discovered DNA structure, revealing genetic molecular basis. 20th century modern synthesis combined genetics with evolution. Today, molecular biology through DNA sequence comparison verified Darwin's evolutionary tree.

quiz.question_en: What is core of Darwin's natural selection theory?
options_en: Adapted individuals more likely survive and reproduce
quiz.explanation_en: Core of Darwin's natural selection theory: hereditary variation exists among individuals, those adapted to environment more likely survive and reproduce, passing favorable traits to offspring. Through countless generations accumulation, populations gradually evolve. Not that organisms 'want' to change, but environment 'selects' adapted ones. This theory explains biological adaptation and diversity through natural mechanisms, no supernatural intervention needed.
